item.title: Report X-2025071033
item.description:
Report X-2025071033

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-08
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 14:45 on 7/8/2025, FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Package Research and Recovery station in Olive Branch, MS concerning a smoking package. An employee noticed the package initially due to a popping/explsosive sound which then released smoke with slight burning to the fibreboard box. The package did not fully catch fire and was contained and put into a salvage package with water to contain any potential fire. The package contained small vehicle tracking devices containing non-rechargeable lithium batteries. The shipment arrived at the overgoods station with no tracking label, so no shipper or recipient information is available, however system restrictions for this incident require shipper info to be entered. Zip 38654 was used to suffice the shipper postal code, however "uknown" was listed for all other fields concerning the shipper since none is avialable on the package.. The shipment was held pending dispostion from Dangerous Goods Administration.
